description:
11.38 colorlevels
Adjust video input frames using levels.

The filter accepts the following options:
name: colorlevels

parameters.description: Adjust red, green, blue and alpha input black point. Allowed ranges for options are [-1.0, 1.0]. Defaults are 0.
parameters.name: rimin

parameters.description: Adjust red, green, blue and alpha input black point. Allowed ranges for options are [-1.0, 1.0]. Defaults are 0.
parameters.name: gimin

parameters.description: Adjust red, green, blue and alpha input black point. Allowed ranges for options are [-1.0, 1.0]. Defaults are 0.
parameters.name: bimin

parameters.description: Adjust red, green, blue and alpha input black point. Allowed ranges for options are [-1.0, 1.0]. Defaults are 0.
parameters.name: aimin

parameters.description:
Adjust red, green, blue and alpha input white point. Allowed ranges for options are [-1.0, 1.0]. Defaults are 1.

Input levels are used to lighten highlights (bright tones), darken shadows (dark tones), change the balance of bright and dark tones.
parameters.name: rimax

parameters.description:
Adjust red, green, blue and alpha input white point. Allowed ranges for options are [-1.0, 1.0]. Defaults are 1.

Input levels are used to lighten highlights (bright tones), darken shadows (dark tones), change the balance of bright and dark tones.
parameters.name: gimax

parameters.description:
Adjust red, green, blue and alpha input white point. Allowed ranges for options are [-1.0, 1.0]. Defaults are 1.

Input levels are used to lighten highlights (bright tones), darken shadows (dark tones), change the balance of bright and dark tones.
parameters.name: bimax

parameters.description:
Adjust red, green, blue and alpha input white point. Allowed ranges for options are [-1.0, 1.0]. Defaults are 1.

Input levels are used to lighten highlights (bright tones), darken shadows (dark tones), change the balance of bright and dark tones.
parameters.name: aimax

parameters.description: Adjust red, green, blue and alpha output black point. Allowed ranges for options are [0, 1.0]. Defaults are 0.
parameters.name: romin

parameters.description: Adjust red, green, blue and alpha output black point. Allowed ranges for options are [0, 1.0]. Defaults are 0.
parameters.name: gomin

parameters.description: Adjust red, green, blue and alpha output black point. Allowed ranges for options are [0, 1.0]. Defaults are 0.
parameters.name: bomin

parameters.description: Adjust red, green, blue and alpha output black point. Allowed ranges for options are [0, 1.0]. Defaults are 0.
parameters.name: aomin

parameters.description:
Adjust red, green, blue and alpha output white point. Allowed ranges for options are [0, 1.0]. Defaults are 1.

Output levels allows manual selection of a constrained output level range.
parameters.name: romax

parameters.description:
Adjust red, green, blue and alpha output white point. Allowed ranges for options are [0, 1.0]. Defaults are 1.

Output levels allows manual selection of a constrained output level range.
parameters.name: gomax

parameters.description:
Adjust red, green, blue and alpha output white point. Allowed ranges for options are [0, 1.0]. Defaults are 1.

Output levels allows manual selection of a constrained output level range.
parameters.name: bomax

parameters.description:
Adjust red, green, blue and alpha output white point. Allowed ranges for options are [0, 1.0]. Defaults are 1.

Output levels allows manual selection of a constrained output level range.
parameters.name: aomax

parameters.description:
Set preserve color mode. The accepted values are:

‘none’

Disable color preserving, this is default.

‘lum’

Preserve luminance.

‘max’

Preserve max value of RGB triplet.

‘avg’

Preserve average value of RGB triplet.

‘sum’

Preserve sum value of RGB triplet.

‘nrm’

Preserve normalized value of RGB triplet.

‘pwr’

Preserve power value of RGB triplet.
parameters.name: preserve

source:
11.38 colorlevels

Adjust video input frames using levels.

The filter accepts the following options:

rimin
gimin
bimin
aimin

Adjust red, green, blue and alpha input black point. Allowed ranges for options are [-1.0, 1.0]. Defaults are 0.

rimax
gimax
bimax
aimax

Adjust red, green, blue and alpha input white point. Allowed ranges for options are [-1.0, 1.0]. Defaults are 1.

Input levels are used to lighten highlights (bright tones), darken shadows (dark tones), change the balance of bright and dark tones.

romin
gomin
bomin
aomin

Adjust red, green, blue and alpha output black point. Allowed ranges for options are [0, 1.0]. Defaults are 0.

romax
gomax
bomax
aomax

Adjust red, green, blue and alpha output white point. Allowed ranges for options are [0, 1.0]. Defaults are 1.

Output levels allows manual selection of a constrained output level range.

preserve

Set preserve color mode. The accepted values are:

‘none’

Disable color preserving, this is default.

‘lum’

Preserve luminance.

‘max’

Preserve max value of RGB triplet.

‘avg’

Preserve average value of RGB triplet.

‘sum’

Preserve sum value of RGB triplet.

‘nrm’

Preserve normalized value of RGB triplet.

‘pwr’

Preserve power value of RGB triplet.
